column4: excuse me.  i'm new to Ubuntu.  I currently have this error in my synaptic package manager.  Does anyone mind helping?

The error details: "E: dpkg was interrupted, you must manually run 'dpkg --configure -a' to correct the problem. "  -- when I run that in the terminal, it says that the command requires Superuser privileges.
automatix itself is liable to cause it's own slew of problems
you were installing java via autoamtix?
then remove completely.  And reinstall java by hand
alright, well, remove it completely anyway.  Then you can install it again later
no, that's a command, with the full path.  I don't know what to tell you, I've never installed DVD stuff
try cd /usr/share/doc/libdvdread3/ (no need for sudo) then 'ls' to see what files *are* there
just backup your thunderbird files before doing it.  You can always back them up
At grub, hit 'e' then remove the 'quiet' and 'splash' from the line, then boot, and you'll know more about what's going on
grub is the bootloader.  Uh, if you don't see the menu (to select which ekrnel) hit escape after your POST screen
you'd edit the config, and setting timestamp_timeout to zero means you have no memory, and a negative number means you have infinite.
screen really is the most productive thing you'll get.  Everything else is just individual programs.
